Posts.Content:
Thanks, it's hard to find detail info on this condition as it is rare, but thanks anyway. :)
TO GOD BE THE GLORY!!!
Posts.Title: My biopsy results came in today!

Posts.Content:
Jsher, I am going through the same as you, I have very dense breast and they found microcalcifications and something that they can't make out a cyst or mass? I had the stereotactic biopsy on the 18th, I got my results back today, they found a complex selerosing lesion that was benign. I do have to have surgery to have it removed and tested further to be sure it is totally benign, I have had two other benign masses removed from each of my breast. It is so much better to know, I am so glad you are having the biopsy and I hope you come back and let us know the outcome. God bless!!!
TO GOD BE THE GLORY!!!
Posts.Title: Stereotactic Biopsy and calcifications

Posts.Content:
Sorry if I confuse you, my two previous benign mass were not the same as I have now with this being a Radial Scar also called complex selerosing lesion. It is said to be rare and I was only asking if any on this fourm has ever had this and if so to share their info.
The latter of my post was me simply sharing what I have experience in the past, and that I believe that this new diagnoses of this lesion would be benign after it is removed and sent to pathology. I was not saying this was my 3rd time with the same type of mass.
I may be confusing you more sorry! :)
TO GOD BE THE GLORY!!!
Posts.Title: My biopsy results came in today!

Posts.Content:
I got the results of my stereotactic biopsy today and they said I have a complex selerosing lesion (benign) they want to do surgery to remove and test further to make sure no cancer is hiding in or behind it.
Has anyone ever had this or have any info to share?
This will be the 3rd time I've had to have a mass removed from my breast and believing that this lesion will be totally benign too after it's sent to pathology.
Posts.Title: My biopsy results came in today!

Posts.Content:
Hi Majik1019, I do understand your post and what you are going through, I am going through the same, got my results yesterday for Radial Scar/Complex Selerosing Complex is another name for it.
I am meeting with surgeon on May 2nd, it has to be removed and sent to pathology because cancer could be hiding in it or behind it. I can't wait to get it out and know for sure. Doc says it is a very rare thing to have, not a whole lot of info on fourms, most think that it is as it states (scaring) and do not realize that it looks like breast cancer on a screening but is really a lesion. The only way to know the difference for sure is a biopsy, my doc says the protocol is to remove them for further testing. 
I pray all turns out well for you.
Posts.Title: Radial scar formation
